Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2016 02:11AM loriann wrote: Hello everyone! Looks like I am joining the party...again! My first go round was in 2007. IDC in the left breast and lymph nodes...did chemo first (dose dense ACT) followed by lumpectomy and radiation. Now here I am almost 9 years later...IDC, same breast. In just 2 weeks I have had a mammo, an ultrasound, a biopsy, another mammo, genetic testing, a pet scan, a muga scan, 2 oncologist appointments and one surgeon appointment...along with work! I forgot how fun this all was! LOL  Saw the oncologist today and all results are in...triple negative like before, BRAC2 positive, pet scan clear and muga looks great! I will be doing chemo first again but a new combo this time, Carboplatin and Gemzar, followed by a bilateral mastectomy with reconstruction and then some work on the ovaries somewhere in not so distant future. Port insertion is next Thursday with first chemo the day after, September 9th...2 days after my 51st birthday.  Other than some tears..ok..alot of tears the day I got confirmation, I am doing way better than last time...its the unknown that is so scary....but I have done this before..and I will do it again...and again...for as long as it takes! My grade 3 cells responded amazingly to chemo the first go around and the tumor was completely gone when surgery time rolled around. The new cocktail makes me a little nervous just because I KNOW the other worked so well...but new studies show promise with Carboplatin for triple negative.  I shaved all my shoulder length hair off the first time around (yeah..that sucked!) and after reading mixed results for Carboplatin and hair loss I am going to test the waters and see what happens....I am expecting complete loss so if I get something less it will just be a nice surprise. I work full time and am going to try to continue that with a modified position and will be having chemo on Fridays and take the weekend to regroup!  I look forward to chatting with you all and following along on this journey we are all making! Best of luck to all of us!!
Posts.Title: Who is starting chemo in September 2016? MFalabella smilethrupain

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2016 07:21AM loriann wrote: Hello everyone. Just thought I would check in. I haven't posted much but I read most every post. I had my port put in on Thursday without any problems and pretty much slept on the couch all day after that. First chemo session was yesterday and other than the 4 hour wait on paperwork (due to the fact the center never sent it to my insurance...don't get me started!) it went off with no further snafus! I am doing Carboplatin and Gemzar and other than a slight under the weather feeling I am doing pretty good. Almost nine years ago I did dose dense ACT so I am hoping things seem a bit easier this time..though I am ALSO nine years older. I have read mixed reviews on hair loss with this combo so I am going to go ahead and count on it and be happily surprised if it stays albeit thinner (its thick as it is so we'll just see). I shaved it off the first time around, bought an expensive wig that got worn twice and pretty much lived in hats and bandanas. Today I ordered some human hair bangs and a couple of ruffled snood/bandana pull ons that look cute and will go with those if the hair decides it wants to tuck tail and run hide. I will get just the Gemzar this Thursday or Friday and then have 2 weeks off and then start the cycle all over again. I plan to return to work on Monday with a modified job and they are being great about it...for now anyway...I hope that continues. I am taking my Zofran pretty much every 6 hours for these next 3 days because I don't want to test the waters. I did an Emend tri pack for the three days after chemo last time with the ACT and never threw up once....I'd like it to be the same way this time. I had a consult with a plastic surgeon and will have one more with another to decide my plan of action. I need to do some research on implant VS diep reconstruction. I would have to drive an hour 1/2 to 2 hours if I want diep as they are not done any closer than that for me. Can anyone chime in on this if you have already had surgery? Going to take a nice shower and run a couple of errands then take it easy for the rest of the weekend. I have been told day 3 may be a sort of crashing day for me so I would like to keep up on the small things I feel comfortable doing until that happens. Wishing all of you great days ahead and strength to get through the not so great ones! Hugs all around!
Posts.Title: Who is starting chemo in September 2016? MFalabella smilethrupain

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 03:36PM - edited Nov 29, 2007 03:37PM by loriann Maryann, great to hear you're doing good with NED!  I do trust my team of doctors so I'm good with their recommendation....I just want to start!  I figure the sooner I start the sooner I'm done and hopefully cured!!
Posts.Title: Treatment plan changed again! Help loriann TerryNY

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 03:22PM loriann wrote: Thanks for the input!  I must say I have handled all this well but hated preparing for something only to find we had changed plans again.  Just needed that reassurance that the cancer is not taking over as I type!! LOL  Just want to get started!  I've got vacation plans I want to keep (and they are giving me something to look forward to!) Vegas at the end of June and Disney World in September!  My 2 favorite places and I see, Trigeek, that you are in Orlando..lucky girl!  Thanks for the comfort! Lori
Posts.Title: Treatment plan changed again! Help loriann TerryNY

Posts.Content: loriann wrote: I also posted this on the "Help me get thru treatment board" but hoped someone here may have so good advise also. OK. I'm pretty new here but have been reading non stop.  I found a lump in my armpit 4 days before my scheduled annual with the OB/GYN.  That was Nov. 2nd. Had mammogram and ultrasound on Nov. 8th, biopsy on the 9th, CT scans, bone scan on the 12th along with positive diagnosis of tumor in breast and lymph nodes.  Original plan was chemo, surgery, radiation.  Then when I couldn't get in on a clinical trial due to core biospy instead of needle biopsy we decided on surgury, chemo, radiation .  Just had MRI on Saturday, results on Tuesday show tumor at 2.7 cm vs the 1.7 cm measured on the ultrasound.  Surgery (lumpectomy and lymph node removal) was scheduled for Monday (12-3) but now I just got a call from the surgeon who said after reviewing the MRI results with the oncologist they think we should go back to chemo, surgery, radiation to try and shrink the tumor first and to be able to visually see how the tumor is responding to the chemo using ultrasound.  So now a few questions (and of course the oncologist office is closed)....so I'm still having the port put in on Monday.  Is there a waiting period after that before I can start chemo.  I want started on something, ANYTHING, now!  Should I be able to start the chemo next week as well?  And for anyone who had chemo first then surgery..how did it go and why did they think that was best.  My surgeon is afraid of the cosmetic result of the lumpectomy unless we do chemo first to shrink it.  At this point I'm not too concerned about a cosmetic result...I just want to get started at something that will start killing this stupid thing that is interfering with my life!  Thanks for letting me rant a bit...Info or advice please!!  Lori Don't wait until everything is perfect before you decide to enjoy your life! Dx 11/2007, IDC, Left, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Treatment plan changed again! Help loriann TerryNY

Posts.Content: loriann wrote: Hi all.  New here and still taking it all in.  I am having surgery on Dec. 3rd, lumpectomy and positive lymph node removal, and will then move on to chemo and radiation.  I was just wondering how soon you started chemo after surgury....I'm sure each case can be different but I have been told 3-4 weeks.  I would just as soon start the sooner the better!!  In your experience, were you ready in 3 weeks? Don't wait until everything is perfect before you decide to enjoy your life! Dx 11/2007, IDC, Left, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Starting chemo after lumpectomy..how long? loriann Keenie

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2007 02:23PM - edited Nov 28, 2007 02:24PM by loriann Hi all!  Well, I talked to doctor yesterday regarding MRI results and fortunately it did not show anything other than we expected so that was good!  She did say a few more lymph nodes looked suspicious but since we know they are positive and coming out anyway she was not additionaly concerned (at least not any more concerned than before since we knew some were positive already). Opietaylor - My MRI also showed the tumor larger than on the ultrasound which my doctor said was usual, so now instead of 1.7 cm on ultrasound it shows 2.7 cm on MRI.  Anyone know is that normal...showing larger on MRI?  Anyway, I guess I'm as ready as I can be for surgery on Monday so please think of me and I'll keep you updated!  At least I'm going to get 2 weeks off work!!  Hopefully I'll feel good enough to enjoy it!!  Lori
Posts.Title: Starting chemo after lumpectomy..how long? loriann Keenie

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2007 05:06PM loriann wrote: Opie, LOL about your girls.  I was told mine are also very dense and apparently very dumb to allow themselves to become endangered!  Have I not taught them anything!!  Well, I'm about to teach 'em a lesson!  I'm sure you can't help but be anxious about the chemo and I hope it goes as well as possible for you.  I'll be there with you starting in January!  Tare care!  Lori
Posts.Title: Starting chemo after lumpectomy..how long? loriann Keenie

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2007 12:31AM loriann wrote: Hi all.  Well, today the surgeon called and we are going back to the original plan of chemo first, then surgery and radiation.  She's concerned about the cosmetic result of the lumptectomy and would also like to be able to see how the tumor responds to the chemo using ultrasound.  So now when I go in Monday it will just be to get the port put in.  I have to call the oncologist tomorrow and will tell her that I want to start the chemo next week!!  I'm tired of the short delays and want to get started!  As I'm sure we all do!  Thanks, Lori
Posts.Title: Starting chemo after lumpectomy..how long? loriann Keenie

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2007 06:37PM loriann wrote: Thanks for the replies.  I will also be having my port put in during the lumpectomy and will be ready to go when they tell me I can.  I am pretty sure I am doing the AC for 4 cycles and then I guess taxol for 4 cycles.  That all has yet to be confirmed.  I had a core biopsy on the lymph node (which I could feel and is how this all started) and it was positive along with a 1.7 x 1.6 cm tumor in the breast.  I just had an MRI Saturday and doctor is going to read that today and warned me not to freak out if she calls me for another biopsy since the MRI can show things that are not cancer.  I'm hoping nothing unexpected shows at all.  I am also waiting for the Her2 results but do know that I am ER-/PR+ and other scans (CT of chest,abdomen & pelvis and bone scan looked good) Thank goodness!  I will have to check out the chat now that I am getting more comfortable with all this.  I have a friend who had BC so she is helpful and I really like my doctors.  I have my wig all ready to go as well!  Looking on the bright side...I won't have to color my grey roots for awhile!!  I'm only 42 and for me that's too young for the grey!!  Thanks, Lori
Posts.Title: Starting chemo after lumpectomy..how long? loriann Keenie

Posts.Content: loriann wrote: Hi all.  I am set to have surgery on Monday (lumpectomy & AND) and was wondering how your range of motion was 11 days out.  I'm not really expecting any trouble from the lumpectomy but with the AND I'm wondering how hard it will be to raise and keep my arm over my head 11 days later.  That is when my appointment for simulation is with rads starting soon after that.  Just wanted to hear some experiences.  Thanks, Lori Don't wait until everything is perfect before you decide to enjoy your life! Posts.Title: Lumpectomy & axillary dissection ?? loriann frogger

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 06:34AM loriann wrote: Hi all!  Figured I'd chime in now that it's all over.  Surgery was Monday, I came home Tuesday with one drain.  Took pain meds thru Wednesday and then one more on Friday before I went back to see surgeon since I was worried about the drain coming out.  She did take out the drain and it was a piece of cake!  Not at all like the drain removal when I had thyroid surgery!!  The thing that bothers me the most is the numbness but hopefully most of that will pass in time!  I had neoadjuvant chemo which had basically gotten rid of (shrunk) the tumors and received the best possible pathology report!!  No cancer in the breast tissue removed or in the 16 lymph nodes that were removed!!  I'm carefully using the left arm as normally as I can and still hope to keep my radiation simulation appointment next Friday!  Thanks for all of your input here!  Take care, Lori
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy & axillary dissection ?? loriann frogger

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2008 10:40PM loriann wrote: Hi all!  I just wanted to check in and say that I was able to keep my simulation appointment yesterday.  The arm is still a little sore but simulation was not a problem.  Actually, I would say the worst part was one of the tattoo's.  I got 6 and the ones that went into some fat (5 of them) were no problem but the one that went in right between the boobs really stung!  I guess it's a good thing I never tried to get a real tattoo as I'm sure I never could have fininshed it!! LOL So now I will start radiation on Thursday next week (30 tx's) and will be done May 28th!  That gives me plenty of time to rest up before the June 23rd trip to VEGAS!!  Yahoo!!  Now if only I could get my hair to grow back faster!! Hope you are all well!!  Lori
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy & axillary dissection ?? loriann frogger

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 12:14AM loriann wrote: Hi Penny!  I know this sucks, doesn't it!!  So much information comes at you so quick and you have to hope you are making the best choices....that's all we can do, ya know?  I wish you the best!  Based on the info I am getting, I'm actually dreading the lymph node disection worse than the lumpectomy.  We know they are positive so now I can't stop wondering about how many are involved!  Still waiting on my Her2/neu results too!  I really love my doctor though and I gotta believe that counts for something!  Keep the faith!  Lori
